intro: Boerhavia sonorae, commonly known as desert bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, blue to violet flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating adaptability to harsh, dry conditions. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Boerhavia sonorae plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
